required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: User Experience of a Mobile Application
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the User Experience of a Mobile Application in Recording Primary Caregiver Reported Outcomes of Infants

lead_sponsor.agency: Danone Asia Pacific Holdings Pte, Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Danone Asia Pacific Holdings Pte, Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the user experience of the use of the different modules / trackers in the mobile application in recording primary caregiver reported outcomes of infants

detailed_description.textblock: Using a questionnaire to collect overall user experience, frequency of usage, feedback of each module in the mobile application

clinical_study.why_stopped: Delay in recruitment due to corona virus pandemic resulted in a newer version of mobile app made available and testing on the old version will be redundant.

primary_outcome.description: Using a questionnaire to assess primary caregiver reported overall experience on a 5-point scale (Very Poor to Very Good) of the mobile application

secondary_outcome.measure: User experience (ease of use) - Primary Caregiver
secondary_outcome.description: Using a questionnaire to assess primary caregiver ease of use (Very Poor to Very Good or Did Not Use) of use of different modules/trackers in the mobile application

secondary_outcome.measure: User experience (frequency of use) - Primary Caregiver
secondary_outcome.description: Using a questionnaire to assess primary caregiver frequency (Rarely to Always) of use of different modules/trackers in the mobile application
Using a questionnaire to assess HCP reported usefulness (not useful at all to very useful) of the data generation by the mobile application
Using a questionnaire to assess HCP reported relevance (not relevant at all to very relevant) of the data generation by the mobile application

other_outcome.measure: User experience (ease of use) - Primary Caregiver from Day 0 to Day 45
other_outcome.description: Using a questionnaire to assess primary caregiver reported user experience of different modules/trackers in the mobile application on a 5-point scale (Very Poor to Very Good) of the mobile application

other_outcome.measure: User experience (frequency of use) - Primary Caregiver from Day 0 to Day 45
other_outcome.description: Using a questionnaire to assess primary caregiver reported user frequency of use of different modules/trackers in the mobile application on a 5-point scale (Rarely to Always) of the mobile application

other_outcome.measure: User experience (quality of insights) - Primary Caregiver from Day 0 to Day 45
other_outcome.description: Using a questionnaire to collect quality of insights on a 5-point scale (Very Poor to Very Good) to describe primary caregiver reported events in the modules/trackers in the mobile application

other_outcome.measure: User experience (weighing scale) - Primary Caregiver from Day 0 to Day 45
other_outcome.description: Using a questionnaire to assess primary caregiver user experience on a 5-point scale (Very Poor to Very Good) for the use of the weighing scale in measuring weight of their infants

other_outcome.measure: User feedback (weighing scale) - Primary Caregiver from Day 0 to Day 45
other_outcome.description: Using an open-ended question to collect primary caregiver feedback for the use of the weighing scale in measuring weight of their infants

arm_group.description: Primary Caregiver and infant who is less than or equal to 12 months old

study_pop.textblock: Infants from birth to ≤ 12 months of age and their primary caregiver

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Infants from birth to ≤ 12 months of age.
2. Primary caregiver should have access to the internet and a smartphone or tablet to access the mobile application.
3. Primary caregiver should be able to comprehend the content in the mobile application and complete the questionnaires in English.
4. Primary caregiver takes care of the infant more than 50% of the time
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incapability of the primary caregiver to access the mobile application using a smartphone or tablet with internet
